item.title: Start Learning Emacs
item.description:
March 7th, 2019.

I need to mark this date because on that day I decided to seriously learn Emacs and switch to it as my primary text editor after my 12 years Vim journey.

Why? Because currently I am working on the new design of Gemsby and I have chosen to use TypeScript for the work. Unfortunately, TypeScript support in Vim is very weak at this moment, I need to spend a lot of time to fight my text editor which I would rather not to do. And the plugins’ development seems to be moving very slowly. This is critial becase TypeScript the language itself is moving very quickly, if the plugins can’t keep up with the pace, developers will abandon the editor, then I will have no choice but switch to a different text editor… ðŸ˜¢
